mrs.lateef_aha: I got the copper iud put in after my first daughter was born. I only had it in for 6 months because my body started to reject it. I got had another iud put in. Even though I felt my hormones were more balanced. I need up growing cyst on my ovaries, having one rupture. I left it in for the full 5 years and when it was time to take it out my husband and I were wanted to try to have a child. Immediately after my hormones were all over the place. I hadn't had a chance to try it yet because we are expecting again but it's my next choice for birth control. Self control has to play a part in it though too lol. ydivadior: I have unfortunately had the worse experience with all birth control since the age of 18 now 35. My body rejected the hormones and every side effect you could imagine I experienced (headaches, acne, weight gain bleeding etc). Even with the patch it ate through my skin so bad I still have scars on my body from it. When I was in my mid 20s I was very excited about the copper IUD because for the first time I was able to have birth-control that did not have hormones. Unfortunately my body rejected it after the first insertion. They had to then put it back in via ultrasound. That is when the horror begin. I would bleed so bad on my periods that I would have to wear both tampons and pads at the same time and change hourly. I unfortunately even bled through my bridesmaid dress at my best friends wedding (horrified) because of the excessive bleeding. The day I took that out of my body was the happiest day of my life. I just wanted control back over my body. After that I remained abstinent for years. Now I track my cycle and ovulation with Natural Cycles which has worked extremely well for me. And I am 6 years free of BC 🙌🏾

agnesjoker: I was on the pill for 10 years until I found out it increases the likeliness of me getting a stroke since I suffer from great migraines. No one ever told me that lol then my doctor insisted that I quit immediately and suggested the mirena IUD. The reason why I started the pill to begin with is bc I get very bad cramps and had to skip work for the first 2 days every time. Now the iud.. it was the most traumatizing experience of my adulthood. I can’t explain how bad it was. I took strong painkillers before going to the doctor as suggested still had incredible pain when it was put up. The following day I remember waking up and try to get out of bed to take a shower.. I literally crawled to the shower and then passed out from pain. My mom had to come and pick me up from the floor and dry me off and put my pjs on and feed me. I couldn’t move at all. I got it last day of April and got it removed second week of October. All throughout the time I had it I had days where I couldn’t move my legs from pain, I was constantly in bad mood and it took little as nothing to get me upset. I’m very active and I used to run track and now I dance but thru this whole time I couldn’t do any workout activities, even small stuff like walking up stairs could trigger pain that lasted for hrs. Not to mention the horrible acne I got from it. Maybe I had such a bad experience bc my body is sensitive to cramps idk but it was not fun at all 😔 recently I invested in the Daysy that’s gonna help me keep track of my cycle. Sorry for a long comment lol Love from Iceland 🇮🇸

hyyerrsteffie: I used to use the pill for a long time and had always been trying to figure out a better way to not fill my body with hormones but I didn’t really want to use condoms with my fiancé so I kept taking the pill. My friend then got a tumor in her liver because of the pill and I finally decided that was it, there must be another way. Now I basically do what people do when they wanna get pregnant but instead of having sex during that time, I don’t or I use a condom. I check my temperature every morning and track my period in order to track my ovulation. You only ovulate one day a month and sperm can live inside of you for 5 day’s therefore 6 day’s a month you can get pregnant. (So because I am still working on figuring out my ovulation I abstain from sex or use a condom for about a week and a half) works for me and no pregnancy and no hormones 🙌🏼
